intro: Asterocephalus bannaticus, commonly known as the Bannaticus starhead, is a unique flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking star-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Asterocephalus bannaticus is relatively rare and is considered a valuable species for botanical study due to its distinctive morphology and limited distribution.
